name: Bilkent University CS490 Research Project
body:
# Semantic-duplicate Detection of Tweets

Duplicate document detection topic has been studied for years in the information retrieval field of Computer Science. There exist "state-of-art" algorithms for detecting near-duplicate documents efficiently.

In this project, the duplicate tweets posted on Twitter in a specific time-line will be de-duplicated by lexical analysis of tweets in our dataset.

Student Name: Ali Naci Uysal

Project Supervisor: Prof. Fazlı Can

## Related Papers
[Efficient Semantic-Aware Detection of Near Duplicate Resources](http://livingknowledge.europarchive.org/images/publications/semAwareNDD.pdf)
[Groundhog Day: Near-Duplicate Detection on Twitter](http://www2013.wwwconference.org/proceedings/p1273.pdf)
[CoDet: Sentence-based Containment Detection in News Corpora](http://www.cs.bilkent.edu.tr/~canf/publications/CoDet%20CIKM%202011.pdf)
[Detecting Near-duplicates for Web Crawling](http://www2007.cpsc.ucalgary.ca/papers/paper215.pdf)
[Collection Statistics for Fast Duplicate Document Detection](http://ir.cs.georgetown.edu/publications/downloads/p171-chowdhury.pdf)
[Syntactic Clustering of the Web](http://acberg.com/bigdata/papers/broder_shingling.pdf)

## Meetings
1) January 25, 2016 in EA511: Project proposal report is revised and the topic of the project is narrowed down.
